actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Judiciary.

official_title: A bill to reauthorize appropriations for the Civil Rights Commission Act of 1983, and for other purposes.
short_title: Civil Rights Commission Reauthorization Act of 1996
subjects: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues
subjects_top_term: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

summary.text: Civil Rights Commission Reauthorization Act of 1996 - Amends the Civil Rights Commission Act of 1983 to require approval of a majority of the Commission before the Commission may submit a report or issue a subpoena. Prescribes a procedure for the withholding of the issuance of a subpoena. Allows the Commission, by majority vote, to remove the staff director from office. Provides for the application of the Freedom of Information Act, Privacy Act of 1974, and the Government in the Sunshine Act with regard to the Commission. Authorizes appropriations. Extends the Commission's termination date through FY 1997.

titles.title: Civil Rights Commission Reauthorization Act of 1996
A bill to reauthorize appropriations for the Civil Rights Commission Act of 1983, and for other purposes.
